alert.note: Alert for Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:09AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Kay, Noble, southeastern Grant and central Garfield Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 808 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Kaw Lake to 3 miles north of Marland to near Waukomis. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Enid, Ponca City, Perry, Tonkawa, Newkirk, Waukomis, Garber, Morrison, Covington, Billings, Kaw City, Red Rock, Breckenridge, Marland, Hunter, Fairmont, Kildare, Kaw Lake, Vance Air Force Base, and Hardy. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 186 and 214. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
